lore:
The Great Horned Rat's Children

The Skaven are a vast, teeming horde of rat-men who dwell in the depths beneath the Mortal Realms. Led by the Great Horned Rat, these cunning, treacherous creatures seek to spread their influence across all the realms through a combination of overwhelming numbers, devious technology, and dark magic.

The Under-Empire

Beneath every major city in the Mortal Realms lies a vast network of tunnels, warrens, and underground cities known as the Under-Empire. Here, millions of Skaven toil in endless warrens, breeding, scheming, and preparing for the day when they will rise to claim the surface world as their own.

Clan Structure

Skaven society is divided into Great Clans, each with its own specialized role in the Under-Empire. Clan Verminus provides the vast hordes of clanrats and stormvermin, while Clan Skryre develops the deadly war-machines and weapons that give the Skaven their technological edge.

The Council of Thirteen

The Skaven are ruled by the Council of Thirteen - a group of the most powerful and cunning Skaven lords, each representing one of the Great Clans. Their meetings are filled with treachery, backstabbing, and constant attempts to gain advantage over their rivals, for such is the nature of Skaven politics.

Spearhead Warfare

In the smaller conflicts of the Spearhead campaigns, the Skaven deploy their most versatile and cunning warriors. Clanrats form the backbone of their forces - numerous, expendable, and utterly devoted to the Great Horned Rat. Stormvermin provide elite melee combat, while Warlock Engineers bring devastating war-machines to the battlefield.

Every Skaven warrior fights not for personal glory, but for the advancement of their clan and the ultimate victory of the Great Horned Rat. They are the vermin that will inherit the realms, the plague that will consume all that stands in their way.

armyRules.name: Gnawhole Ambush
armyRules.description: Declare: Pick a friendly unit that is in the tunnels below to use this ability. Effect: Set up that unit wholly within 6" of a corner of the battlefield and more than 9" from all enemy units.

armyRules.name: The Lurking Vermintide
armyRules.description: Declare: Pick a friendly unit that has not been deployed to be the target. Effect: The target unit is set up in reserve in the tunnels below. Units in the tunnels below that have not used the 'Gnawhole Ambush' ability by the end of the third battle round are destroyed.

regimentAbilities.name: Too Quick To Hit-hit
regimentAbilities.description: No mortal damage is inflicted on friendly units when they use RETREAT abilities.

regimentAbilities.name: Warpstone-laced Bullets
regimentAbilities.description: Declare: Pick a ranged weapon a friendly unit is armed with. Effect: That weapon has Crit (Mortal) this phase.

enhancements.name: Skryre Connections
enhancements.description: Your general's Ratling Pistol has an Attacks characteristic of 2D6 instead of D6.

enhancements.name: Warpstone Charm
enhancements.description: Subtract 1 from save rolls for enemy units in combat with your general.

ability.name: Warpstone Charm
ability.description: Subtract 1 from save rolls for enemy units in combat with your general.

modifications.name: Ward (5+)
modifications.description: Roll a dice each time a wound or mortal wound is allocated to this unit. On a 5+, that wound or mortal wound is negated.

enhancements.name: Lead the Seething Horde
enhancements.description: Instead of using the set-up instructions in the 'Call for Reinforcements' ability, the replacement unit can be set up wholly within 13" of this unit and not in combat.

ability.name: Lead the Seething Horde
ability.description: Instead of using the set-up instructions in the 'Call for Reinforcements' ability, the replacement unit can be set up wholly within 13" of this unit and not in combat.

abilities.name: Crit (Auto-wound)
abilities.description: If the roll to hit is a critical hit, the target is automatically wounded.

abilities.name: Shoot in Combat
abilities.description: This weapon can be used even if the bearer is within 3 inches of an enemy unit.

abilities.name: Companion
abilities.description: Unless otherwise specified, attacks made by this weapon cannot get an improvement to their hit, wound or weapon characteristics.

abilities.name: Cornered Rat
abilities.description: While this unit is damaged, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic of its Warforged Halberd.

abilities.name: Ward (6+)
abilities.description: Roll a dice each time a wound or mortal wound is allocated to this unit. On a 6+, that wound or mortal wound is negated.

abilities.name: Will of the Horned Rat
abilities.description: Declare: Pick a friendly unit wholly within 13" of this unit to be the target, then roll a dice. Effect: On a 3+, add the roll to the target's control score until the start of your next turn.

abilities.name: Wither
abilities.description: Declare: Pick a visible enemy unit within 13" of this unit to be the target, then make a casting roll of 2D6. Effect: On a 6+, inflict D3 mortal damage on the target.

abilities.name: Crit (Auto-wound)
abilities.description: If the roll to hit is a critical hit, the target is automatically wounded.

abilities.name: MORE-MORE WARP ENERGY!
abilities.description: Reaction: You declared a SHOOT ability for this unit and it has not used a MOVE ability this turn. Effect: Roll a dice. On a 2+, set the Damage characteristic of its Warplock Musket to 3 this phase. On a 1, inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit.

abilities.name: Shoot in Combat
abilities.description: This weapon can be used even if the bearer is within 3 inches of an enemy unit.

abilities.name: Unleashed Warp-fury
abilities.description: Effect: Inflict D3 mortal damage on this unit. Then, add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of its melee weapons this phase.

abilities.name: Seething Swarm
abilities.description: Effect: You can return D3 slain models to this unit at the end of any turn.
